meanings.definition: To cast oneself face down on the ground in humility or submission.
meanings.sent1: The defeated knight would abject himself before the king.
meanings.sent2: She decided to abject herself in front of the council to seek forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: In a moment of jest, he abjected himself dramatically in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The protesters abjected themselves in protest against the unjust law.
meanings.sent5: The criminal chose to abject himself before the judge, pleading for leniency.
